original_title: Singapore based GoodHope’s announce Sri Lanka delisting
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Four listed subsidiaries of Singapore based Goodhope Asia Holdings Ltd (GAHL) related to edible oil, announced de-listing from Sri Lanka’s Colombo stock exchange (CSE) as the mother company has agreed to buy back shares.

Good Hope. Indo Malay, Selising and Shalimar (Malay), as per a decision taken by the board of directors at the meeting held on May 17 has decided to de list the shares of the respective companies with a total around twenty-two billion rupees of market capitalization, from the official list of the CSE.

The board of Directors of the respective companies have made arrangements with the mother company, the majority shareholder of the four companies, which has indicated its willingness to obtain the shares held by minority shareholders.

The company has said, it is willing to but Good hope shares at 3,513 rupees, Indo Malay at 2,805 rupees, Selinsing at 2,593 rupees and Shalimar (Malay) at 2,452 rupees per share from the holders who may wish to divest or sell.
A circular to the shareholders with full details of the proposed delisting will be issued shortly by the company, a statement by the respective companies said. (Colombo/ May 17/2023)
